bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Emilie Lawrence Reed, May 6, 1924

div1.p: Kean informs Emilie Lawrence Reed that the manuscript of Gorgas' biography might be corrected to reflect Reed's role. He will retire to Washington this summer.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Emilie Lawrence Reed, May 6, 1924
div1.p:
Here is a copy of a
nice letter which came yester-
day from the distinguished
Chief of the Bureau of Entomo-
logy, which pleases me very
much much. I have sent
a copy of it to Mr Hendrick,
and asked him to pass it in
to Dr Henry Carter who is
correcting the manuscript of
the Gorgas biography- So if
they dont correct their State-
ments they will sin against
the light- I wish I could
see your flower garden-
I want to find a little
cottage with a garden in
the outskirts of Washington
and have a garden too.
I expect to go there in July-
Mrs. K will not come untill autumn
div1.closer:
Sincerely your friend J. R. Kean I was so much pleased to get
your last note from Blue Ridge
